attributes.action: HMG must investigate properly dual voting by people registered in two places
attributes.additional_details: If a sample of 50 postal  votes, selected from 750, were found to contain 7 credibly fraudulent, Hypergeometric probability yields 99% confidence that the 750 have between 38 and 216 similar faults, with 91 as a credible, robust estimate of the true total. Such analysis was developed and documented extensively then offered to Minister of State for the Constitution, via an MP, but not apparently felt useful to HMG. It might have solved many problems since 2016. Might it yet?
attributes.background: In 2017 some students boasted of voting twice. Only 10% doing so might have swung 15+ seats. Careful examination of marked registers and available data could identify credible cases. Sampling mathematics offers reliable estimates of the total. Maybe only 43% of voters could manage 48% of votes.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions which call for actions that are the responsibility of the UK Government or Parliament. Investigating alleged breaches of electoral law is the responsibility of the police and Electoral Commission, which are independent of both the Government and Parliament.

You could raise the issue with the Electoral Commission:

https://www.electoralcommission.org.uk/contact-us
